results.title: Love My Way: Stick Sisters
results.creator_credit: Ian Watson, Claudia Karvan, John Edwards, Foxtel, New South Wales Film and Television Office, Showtime, Southern Star Entertainment and Louise Fox
results.brief_description:
The groundbreaking, multiple award-winning drama series ‘Love My Way’ was one of the first Australian productions made exclusively for subscription television (Foxtel). This enabled Foxtel to allow the producers ‘absolute creative freedom…to carve out a piece of TV drama that was edgy, daring, provocative’ (Foxtel’s Brian Walsh).

Revolving around the untidy lives and complicated loves of a contemporary Australian blended family and their friends, ‘Love My Way’ was both critically acclaimed and highly successful, with a further two seasons produced following the initial ten episodes of Series 1.

Series 1, Episode 5 first aired on Foxtel on 13th December 2004.

results.title: Triptych
results.creator_credit: Walter Bird, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Walter Bird recalls a time when he was asked “Where are you from?”, and answered by describing where his house was situated in the neighbourhood. Growing up, he started to learn the implications of that question. He realised that he was ethnically different from other Australian-born children. Being the child of immigrants, Walter weighs up the positives and negatives of being a first generation Australian and shares his experiences when he finally travelled to his parents’ countries.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Walter Bird, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI

results.title: Love My Way: A Different Planet
results.creator_credit: Jessica Hobbs, Claudia Karvan, John Edwards, Foxtel, New South Wales Film and Television Office, Showtime, Southern Star Entertainment and Louise Fox
results.brief_description:
The groundbreaking, multiple award-winning drama series ‘Love My Way’ was one of the first Australian productions made exclusively for subscription television (Foxtel). This enabled Foxtel to allow the producers ‘absolute creative freedom…to carve out a piece of TV drama that was edgy, daring, provocative’ (Foxtel’s Brian Walsh).

Revolving around the untidy lives and complicated loves of a contemporary Australian blended family and their friends, ‘Love My Way’ was both critically acclaimed and highly successful, with a further two seasons produced following the initial ten episodes of Series 1.

Series 1, Episode 8 first aired on Foxtel on 17th January 2005.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Jessica Hobbs, Claudia Karvan, John Edwards, Foxtel, New South Wales Film and Television Office, Showtime, Southern Star Entertainment and Louise Fox

results.title: The Invisible net
results.creator_credit: Sarah Vincent, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Sarah Vincent looks at 2008, a year of immense ups and downs, and, in particular, when she was diagnosed with cancer. Rather than dwelling on the treatment and anxiety, Sarah chooses to focus on the amazing support she received from her community of family, friends, the school and neighbours. Through their support, Sarah learned to count her blessings and credits cancer with changing her outlook on life.
